attributes.action: Ask government to force car manufactures to must include spare wheel in all cars
attributes.background: Not having a spare wheel causes , unnecessary waste of time,obstructions, gives stress and force motorists to join a recovery service.

attributes.action: Combine the current individual SIA Licences to a single multi-category licence.
attributes.background:
The Security Industry Authority (SIA) have a number of individual front-line licences (Close Protection, Door Supervisor, Security Guarding, CCTV, CViT and Vehicle Immobilisation). Each costing £110-220 each.
If they were to adopt an approach similar to the DVLA there would be a saving to all.
attributes.additional_details: By adopting a DVLA style single licence (which could still have clear colour coding for easy identification) there would be significant cost savings to the individual, the SIA and the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS). Licences could still be renewed every 3 years and the individual could still be DBS checked, at the current fee of £220. But the production and administration costs would be reduced, reducing plastic as well as cost and administrative burdens on all involved.

attributes.action: Extend the CAMHS upper age limit to 21
attributes.background: Mental illnesses do not disappear at the age of 18, yet it seems that in the majority of cases, once they turn 18, vulnerable young people are discharged from CAMHS, regardless of their mental health situation, not knowing whether they'll be considered "ill enough" by adult mental health services.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS - child and adolescent mental health services
Currently discharge their patients at 18 regardless of whether they have recovered well enough or not. 
Even if the patient is referred to adult mental health services, 9 times out of 20 they're not considered "ill enough" to get help.
It's also very unsettling for a fragile young person to have to get used to a new key worker (if they do get accepted by adult services), when they have established a good relationship with their CAMHS worker

attributes.action: Stop "Public Duty Cost Allowance" ex Prime ministers get £115,000 every year.
attributes.background:
Ex Prime ministers should not be getting an extra 5-6 times the national average wage! The public do not know how this money is being spent. 

Ex Prime Ministers spent £538,067 between them in 2016-17.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/tony-blair-one-million-taxpayer-claim-public-duty-cost-allowance-prime-minister-cabinet-office-a8616731.html
 
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/647027/page_87_public_duty_cost_allowance.csv/preview
 
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/nick-clegg-claims-annual-expenses-allowance-deputy-prime-minister-liberal-democrats-public-duty-cost-a8158781.html

attributes.action: Tougher laws to protect Fisheries & Rivers from the illegal theft of fish.
attributes.background:
Fisheries & Rivers are being robbed of there fish stocks and the Police just do not seem to hase the powers to effectively stop this from happening.
New laws are needed to enable an effective deterent to be in place, at the moment very few if any are being dealt with, there is currently no deterent
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to make the penalties harder and that would enable the Police and Environment Agency to actually create a respect for this law, the current level of protection is being broken with no fear of the consequences if caught.

attributes.action: Seek agreement to extend Article 50 period by one year to achieve best possible
attributes.background: With the government in crisis and running out of time to negotiate a Brexit deal, article 50 must be extended. If the U.K. is to get a good deal, we will need more time. Therefore, Article 50 must be extended to March 29th, 2020 or we risk a catastrophe.

attributes.action: Stop the resale of concert tickets on secondary websites above face value price
attributes.background:
Concert tickets sell out within minutes due to use of specialist software purchasing them in mass.

New laws put in place earlier this year have seemingly made no difference.
attributes.additional_details:
Reselling football tickets is illegal under section 166 Criminal Justice and Public Order Act 1994. This prevents touts from buying and reselling at inflated prices. 

We need something similar for concert tickets. One option is to not allow secondary sites to resell concert tickets for more than the face value, excluding transaction fees and a small fee to ensure profit for the site. Selling at a highly inflated rate should not be allowed. It's unbeneficial for fans and the music business alike. 

The fan fair alliance goes into more detail on this - http://fanfairalliance.org/faqs/

attributes.action: workers on benefits should be able to do overtime when needed without deductions
attributes.background: Workers who claim benefits should be able to do overtime e.g. 20 hours, when needed, over a tax year to help in times of hardship. After the capped overtime hours have been used you cannot do anymore in that year.
attributes.additional_details: This proposal came about after I wanted to consider overtime to help me and my son, but I am unable to do so.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on fuel for the road haulage industry
attributes.background: Reduce fuel tax for the road haulage industry.
attributes.additional_details: Fuel is the biggest out may in road haulage. The cost is increasing and forcing small business into financial stuggle. The reduce in tax would encourage hauliers to expand and boost the economy. Increase wages run more fuel efficient/green vehicles

attributes.action: Introduce a 12-month residency requirement for candidates to Parliament
attributes.background: In order for Parliament to become truly representative, this petition proposes introducing legislation to require persons standing for Parliament to be resident in their constituency for at least 12 months prior to election day.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is meant to be a representative democracy.  However, parties will often choose a favoured member to run for a seat to maximise their chances of winning, even though they have no genuine connection to the local community.  As a result, Parliament is not a collection of community representatives, but a collection of preferred party members.

attributes.action: Stop charging students council tax on property rented for graduating year
attributes.background: Students are exempt from paying council tax however if a student is still living in student accommodation after they’ve graduated, they’re expected to pay the remaining months, even though their finically situation is still the same or most of the time, even worse.
attributes.additional_details: Contracts are only available for 12 months from most letting agents therefor trapping students into a fee that most of them can’t afford or have to pay with their student loan which is supposed to be used to help forward they’re education and living costs. We still have to pay this loan back and being forced to give a large amount of it away for a period of time in which you can’t control is very worrying. The exemption of students paying council tax should last their whole tenancy agreement.

attributes.action: Set up a new homes ombudsman to address serious failings in the building sector.
attributes.background: A new independent ombudsman should have powers to impose large fines to the builders of inadequate new build homes. Failing this the builders should offer a refund to the buyers of substandard homes.
attributes.additional_details:
Personal experience of being sold a substandard home. I was advised by the estate agent that a surveyor was unnecessary as my home carried a 10 year warranty. After a couple of months I appointed a Surveyor due to concerns about the inadequate construction of my home, for example, ordered wardrobes to be fitted, unfortunately these couldn’t be fitted due to the sloping of the floors up to 14ml between one wall and the other.

It is is now nearly 12 months since I moved in - there are 112 defects of which 5 are serious.

attributes.action: Remove the 2 year restriction on a 125cc motorcycle upon completion of the CBT.
attributes.background: If you can ride a 125cc for 2 years why not permanently.

attributes.action: Make overtime tax free
attributes.background: We pay tax on our standard hours so we should get our overtime tax free

attributes.action: To dedicate more resources to help men and young boys with mental health issues
attributes.background: As a young man, I’m scared to see statistics about male suicides. It is shocking that very little is being done to tackle the problem of mental health, and more needs to be done to help men and young boys with depression, anxiety and stress among with other issues
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.samaritans.org/about-us/our-research/facts-and-figures-about-suicide

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/11787304/Homelessness-is-a-gendered-issue-and-it-mostly-impacts-men.html

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/birthsdeathsandmarriages/deaths/bulletins/suicidesintheunitedkingdom/2016registrations#main-points

attributes.action: Make all goods vehicles to have speed limiters set at the national speed limit
attributes.background: Legislation needs to be in place making all goods vehicles speed limiters set at the national speed limit in order to reduce overtaking . At present hauliers set their vehicles at a speed of their choice. This causes bunching of LGV's and causes unnecessary overtaking .

attributes.action: Parents must be told if the other parent is convicted of child sex offenses
attributes.background: Parents must be told if their ex is convicted of child sex offenses, even if they don’t have contact with the children at that time.

attributes.action: Work with EU to allow promotion/marketing of infant formula milk(under 6months)
attributes.background: Currently you are unable to to gain advantage points from supermarkets and reatailers such as boots on formula milk (for under 6 months) you can also not buy formula with these advantage points. This is due to a law that prevents the promotion or discount of formula milk for under 6 month olds.
attributes.additional_details: the price of formula is regulated as to stop 'formula shopping' and prevent people from buying the cheapest formula they can find, as this enables mother/fathers to use one brand or staggared brands through out infancy- they were finding that babies where becoming really unwell by getting fed different formulas every week. It also prevents supermarkets trying to push formula that is close to expire. But parents should be able to gain advantage points on buying formula milk.

attributes.action: Introduce yearly mental health checks on the NHS
attributes.background: With how society is nowadays, it is very easy to find yourself struggling. An annual mental health check will give everyone a chance to talk about their feelings to a trained professional who will be able to react to this in a more proactive way than a friend who may not know how to deal with it.
attributes.additional_details: Suicide is now at its all time highest, with it being the most common cause of death for men aged 20-49 across England and Wales. More and more pressures have emerged that we as humans were not originally designed to deal with such as financial worries, the rise of social media and having demanding jobs so there is no wonder 1 in 15 of us have made a suicide attempt at some point in our lives.

attributes.action: Create a central database of registered electors to prevent fraudulent votes
attributes.background: It’s been alleged that students have been openly abusing the fact that the current law allows them and others to register and to vote in TWO locations. As there is NO central database of registered voters there is little chance of being found out if voting twice.

attributes.action: Prevent drug-related overdose deaths: trial supervised drug consumption rooms
attributes.background: Supervised drug consumption facilities have been successfully operating in Europe for 30 years. They reduce the risks of disease transmission through unhygienic injecting, prevent drug-related overdose deaths & connect high-risk drug users with treatment and other health and social services.
attributes.additional_details:
Drug Consumption Rooms also seek to contribute to a reduction in drug use in public places and the presence of discarded needles and other related public order problems linked with open drug scenes. Typically, drug consumption rooms provide drug users with: sterile injecting equipment; counselling services before, during and after
drug consumption; emergency care in the event of overdose; and primary medical care and referral to appropriate social healthcare and addiction treatment services.

attributes.action: Stop insurance discrimination affecting those with pre existing medical issues
attributes.background: Our society (rightly) talks about equality and yet the Government accepts insurance companies charging people more money for taking out policies - if they have a pre existing medical condition. It's blatant prejudice and discrimination. The government must stop this insurance industry-led practice.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has said (in a letter to MP David Davies) that this is a commercial matter. Yet human rights are not a commercial matter. Life & CIC insurance is necessary for security. The Universal Declaration of Human Rights says: Article 25. (1) Everyone has the right to security in the event of unemployment, sickness, disability... in circumstances beyond his control. 'Everyone' includes people with pre existing medical conditions who cannot afford higher premiums for life/CIC insurance.

attributes.action: Improve the assessment element of Personal Independence Payment
attributes.background:
Assessors training and knowledge is too generalised.
A common complaint with PIP assessments is that assessors cannot be trusted to record accurately what took place during the assessment.
Assessors also deal with a wide range of conditions and are not specialist to each individual condition.
attributes.additional_details: https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201719/cmselect/cmworpen/829/82906.htm

attributes.action: Make it statutory that dogs dna can collected so that councils can fine owners
attributes.background: Dog mess is causing a huge issue in our community by those owners who don’t clear up after their dogs faeces.  It’s already illegal to not clear up after them however you have to be caught in the act.  Let’s empower our environmental officers to deal with this ever growing issue.

attributes.action: Require companies asking for experience to provide work experience to students
attributes.background: It is becoming harder and harder for students to get a work placement for work experience, and more and more companies are asking for experience for entry level positions. I propose that in order to ask for experience for entry level positions, you must provide it to students within reason.
attributes.additional_details:
https://talent.works/blog/2018/03/28/the-science-of-the-job-search-part-iii-61-of-entry-level-jobs-require-3-years-of-experience/ - Although this is an American article, it shows 61% of 'entry level' jobs require experience.

http://www.ukyouthparliament.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/Manifesto-2015-2016.pdf - Work Experience was one of the top four issues raised by 875,000 young people

https://www.theguardian.com/education/2014/may/23/my-son-keen-learn-struggling-find-work-experience - Old but true

attributes.action: Ban tenancies that require rent paid in advance for social housing
attributes.background: Becuase im on universal credit I have to pay £20 pound on top of my rent. Because my rent is meant to be paid in advance but the housing element is paid in arreas, and if I dont pay this I will be breaching my tenacy agreement, I want social housing to be banned from making tenancies like this.
attributes.additional_details: Or if they cant stop making tenancies like this make universal credit housing element paid weekly.

attributes.action: Abolish NI contributions for working women caught in the State Pension Age trap.
attributes.background: Women born in the 1950's have been grievously impacted by the change in SPA and have to continue working. Many of these women have earned the full state pension entitlement by making 35+ years of National Insurance contributions. Such women should be exempt from making further NI contributions.
attributes.additional_details: As an example, take a woman born in 1953. She leaves school in 1970 and starts work full-time expecting to reach SAP in 2013 and retiring. By 2005 she has completed 35 years of work and is eligible for full State Pension. In 2011 she is told she has to work until the age of 66. By 2013 she has paid a total of 43 years of National Insurance contributions. Now she has to work a further 6 years and continue supporting a system that,by now, she thought would be supporting her.

attributes.action: Give an mandatory prison sentence after a death due to physical assault
attributes.background: My father was killed by a punch to the head in 2004 and has never received justice, the man who killed him received only community service as he done a plea bargain and admitted culpable homicide. If you hit someone and kill them it should be a mandatory prison sentence.
attributes.additional_details: No one should be able to enter a plea bargain if they hit someone and the person dies as a result. We all know right from wrong and if you kill someone then justice should serve an instant prison sentence whatever your intentions. We lost my father in 2004 and all the accused got was community service. Where's the justice in that? What does that mean for my poor father who dies of a single punch to the head? He ended up brain dead because of his injury. Help me to stop this.

attributes.action: Require restaurants to give a range of vegan and vegetarian options by law
attributes.background: As it stands there is no actual law that states restaurants must provide vegan and vegetarian options. Veganism is on the rise and gaining real growth as its own lifestyle. most of us feel unfairly treated when our options are greatly limited and social interactions are in decline as a result
attributes.additional_details:
The other reasons are simple. While I firmly believe killing animals is wrong and that a plant based diet brings great benefits I accept not everyone will change. But I do believe that everyone is happy to try or at least take pressure away from the animal farming industry. 
The killing of animals for food and the use of what they provide has been linked to cancer, diabetes and other awful diseases by some studies. We pay millions in treating these.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: I believe that, unless there is a ‘baby changing room’ already allocated, there should be changing facilities in all female AND male bathrooms.
attributes.additional_details: I am tired of visiting family restaurants and being the only adult able to change our baby! I am yet to see baby changing facilities in male bathrooms and it makes life for my husband difficult and especially restricting when he is alone with the children. I also wonder how it must make male, same sex couples feel as parents when neither can visit the ladies bathroom.

attributes.action: Review the way interest is added to student loans.
attributes.background: Many young people will never afford to pay back their student loan.  Not only does the current system saddle young people with debt, it is not good for their mental health to know the loan is being added to monthly. The proposal here is to review the student loan interest system.
attributes.additional_details: Reducing interest rates, to be in line with the current Bank of England interest rate plus running cost of a non profit making company, seems to be a much better prospect for young people. The government will have to pick up the bill for any remaining loan, once the student is 53 years old. Let’s make a system work where young people can realistically pay their loans off or a system where the government subsidises all loans.

attributes.action: We believe Wythenshawe Community Initiative deserves more funding
attributes.background: Wythenshawe Community Initiative are a child daycare centre that provide a safe space for children to play and be looked after, whilst parents are working. Everyday they have children and parents lining up to get a place in however many are turned away due to lack of funding and staff.
attributes.additional_details:
They are a non-profit organisation, based in Manchester and are for children from the ages of five to eleven. 

In 2017 they fundraised £3,498.52 but this is nowhere near enough to support the centre. Many children who turn up at the centre go without breakfast and staff struggle to provide them with enough food due to the lack of money.

attributes.action: Do not endorse Zimbabwe’s harmonised 2018 elections
attributes.background: There is growing evidence that the outcome of Zimbabwe’s harmonised elections was not a result of a free and fair electoral process. This was followed by post-election violence and the alleged slaughter and beatings of civilians by the army.
attributes.additional_details:
Abductions and an intensified crackdown on the opposition is ongoing.

As an activist, and with many Zimbabweans I am appealing to the UK parliament and government to: - suspend further economic, bilateral engagement with Zimbabwe's govt until there is clarity on its human rights situation; -recognise the unsafe political environment in Zimbabwe for opposition and activists; -strongly support concerns raised by EU, Zimbabwe Human Rights Groups and the USA on elections in Zimbabwe; put pressure on Zimbabwe's govt to account for the killing of innocent civilians by the army.

attributes.action: Automatic general election on change in the leadership of the governing party.
attributes.background: Given the substantial change in the character of a political party on changing its leadership, it seems undemocratic for the mandate from a general election to automatically transfer to a new leader with potentially completely different policies without consulting the electorate.
attributes.additional_details: The law should be changed to require a General Election if the leadership of the governing party changes.

attributes.action: All English Local Authorities to notify residents by post of new Consultations
attributes.background: When introducing any legislation affecting residents, The Local Authority/Council must serve notice of any consultation or proposal directly on ALL residents, in additional languages if required, by way of postal service. Local Authorities across England are failing to comply with this requirement
attributes.additional_details: A specific example of this is the introduction of Selective Licensing in Luton, ALL residents in the affected areas have not been informed of the Consultation. The outcome of this consultation will affect all residents of Luton. We are asking for people across England to support this if they have had a similar experience with their Local Authority failing to consult with them on important changes affecting their town/city.

attributes.action: Murdered 4 y/o British national: Urge Pakistani government to deliver justice
attributes.background: This murder has been overlooked for 4 years. Shahryar Ahmad, a British national, was kidnapped outside his grandmother's home in Faisalabad, Pakistan on 21 August 2014, and subsequently murdered by the gang who abducted him.
attributes.additional_details: I, Iftkhar Ahmad, Shahryar's father,  was led to believe for almost 4 months that the kidnappers were holding him for ransom, however it was later discovered that my little boy’s body was found by the police, dumped in a canal a mere 2 days after his abduction. Justice has not been delivered to Shahryar or my family. Urgent intervention by the UK government and parliament is necessary.

attributes.action: Require a minimum 30 minute rest break in a 12-hour shift by law
attributes.background: You are entitled to one rest break of 20 mins if you are employed for more than six hours a day. Therefore, even on a 12-hour shift, you are only legally entitled to ONE 20 mins rest break. This Petition is asking Parliament to change the law, to require a longer break time.
attributes.additional_details:
Andrew Griffiths MP, Minister for Small Business, Consumers & Corporate Responsibility replied on 7 June 2018 to my MP's letter: 
"We keep all our employment regulations under review, including the Working Time Regulations (WTR) 1998 which contain the statutory requirements on rest breaks. 

We currently have no plans to review these provisions, the WTR represent the minimum requirements and employers are free to offer more generous terms to their workers through their employment contracts".

attributes.action: Offer support to Greece regarding the Mati Wildfire Crisis
attributes.background: The Mati wildfire has burned through village, causing 74 fatalities so far, with that number "expected to rise", and with little control over the fire. The United Kingdom should offer assistance in the form of firefighters, aircraft and vehicles to assist the struggling victims of the fire.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.reviewjournal.com/news/nation-and-world/death-toll-from-greece-fires-reaches-74-is-expected-to-rise/amp/

attributes.action: Prevent absent parents from travelling outside the UK if maintenance is unpaid
attributes.background: Recently Australia enforced action against parents with child support debts from travelling in and out of the country until they had settled their arrears. Introducing a similar law into the UK would benefit many UK families and make absent parents face up to their responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/may/27/child-support-debts-record-number-of-parents-prevented-from-travelling-overseas

attributes.action: Ban Staples From Newspapers
attributes.background: Staples are an unnecessary addition to newspapers which are an environmental liability - this petition asks the government to ban the use of staples in newspaper production.
attributes.additional_details:
Staples are for the most part made using steel which is produced with the requirement of a blast furnace and this using large amounts of energy. No staples would also mean that newspapers would be more easily recyclable due to the absence of metal and the decay of newspapers would be much increased.
Banning staples would bring down production costs for newspaper companies And would create a safer environment in factories.

attributes.action: Employers to allow employees paid time off to attend NHS blood donation
attributes.background: I recently asked to leave work for an hour to attend a local blood donation session and was declined it from a large employer. Allow staff time of work on proof of donation letter to attend local blood donation sessions to help save lives

attributes.action: I want Government to create a law so Ayahuasca can be used legally in the UK
attributes.background:
It is a very helpful tool in allowing an individual who feels they want to explore themselves deeper and promotes healing; physically/ physchologically & spiritually. 
Ayahuasca promotes acceptance and resistance, giving power to the individual to decide, what is for them, their best way of being.
attributes.additional_details:
With facilitators supervising space, this provides a safe opportunity to experience the medicine

It is the use of Banisteriopsis caapi. 
A brew of B. caapi & P. viridis is the traditional South American brew. The caapi is particularly important as traditionally the caapi itself is considered to be “ayahuasca” while the DMT-containing plants are simply helpers.

Ayahuasca, also known as yage, is a blend of two plants - the ayahuasca vine and a shrub called chacruna (Psychotria viridis)

attributes.action: Require every vehicle manufactured to have their lights constantly on
attributes.background: Daytime running lights also known as (Drls) are dangerous, travelling around the country I’ve seen far too many people driving at nighttime with only the vehicle drls on, which unfortunately are only on the front of vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: As a professional driver (hgv) I believe drls are very dangerous and all motor vehicles manufactured should now constantly have their lights on, best example car is the Volvo, if the switch is positioned on (0) then the headlights are still on! Several times I have been close to a collision due to this and personally I don’t think it would be fair for anyone to have an accident and potentially injure or even kill a person or family and get punished for it for the sake of making it a legal requirement that vehicle lights are constantly on.

attributes.action: Introduce a system for SIA's to give police more support
attributes.background: Here in my town there are street wardens but after 8pm they sign out they are sia too and from that there is not enough support to the police on busy thursay friday and saturday nights and at times it can be hard to keep the public safe
attributes.additional_details:
I believe there should be more powers for us SIA's like carrying handcuffs and powers of arrest giving out 24 hour town/city bans for behaviours ect and be on pertols and giving police more support and numbers to keep public safe
A police offer said last weekend he was 1 of 10 on duty with 60 cases to deal with on going and over 100 999 callers also tonight there is another team for club pertol of 6 offercers but that's not really enough to keep the public safe in a busy town
We need a change

attributes.action: Ban the import and sale of badger hair in the UK.
attributes.background: Badger hair is often used in Britain because of certain water-retaining properties it has; however, the evidence is that animals suffer, at best, appalling living conditions, and at worst, terrible abuse and neglect, in order to produce this hair.
attributes.additional_details: Badger farms, predominantly in Asia, have been filmed keeping badgers in horrific conditions in order to produce hair for items like shaving brushes and paint brushes. When other options, like horse-hair, and artificial hair, is freely available, there is no reason to support this cruel industry in any way whatsoever, and the UK should take a lead in banning the use of this commodity.

attributes.action: Allow Robert Rihmeek Williams (Meek Mill) into the UK
attributes.background: Robert Rihmeek Williams'(aka Meek Mill) first taste of prison came at the age of 18 when he was caught carrying a gun while shopping at a local grocery store. He has spent his adult life on probation and has been treated unfairly by police officers and courts.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/26/opinion/meek-mill-criminal-justice-reform.html
 
Meek Mill and 76ers Owner Michael Rubin have decided to help get wrongfully accused convicts in the United States out of prison. In the UK we should revisit Meek Mill's visa application, because not only does he connect with many people here, but he can also help the UK by talking to the youth especially with our alarming knife crime statistics this year alone.

attributes.action: Force companies to pay SIA licensed security officers 40% above the minimum wage
attributes.background: Security Officers over the UK are seriously underpaid, and they take huge risks in the job they are doing because of the growing crime rate and the violence within the UK. This petition would look at setting a standard for licensed SIA officer to be paid 40 percent above the minimal wage

attributes.action: Ban the use of single use plastic inside of cereal boxes
attributes.background: Most cereal comes packaged in plastic. The single use plastic bags not only are disposable and have a negative impact of our environment, but are unnecessary. Paper bags or no bags at all should be enough as the box contains all the contents.
attributes.additional_details: By stopping the use of plastic packaging inside cereal boxes, it will save the companies money, help reduce the pollution in our oceans and environment, and lower the amount of trash individuals and families produce. Alternatively, paper bags could be recycled and remade into more bags, creating a closed loop recycling system.

attributes.action: Include all delivery services within the regulatory control of Ofcom
attributes.background: As a largely unregulated industry (other than Royal Mail), the services of delivery companies (Yodel, Hermes etc.) seem to be getting worse. I call on the Government to include all delivery services within the regulatory control of Ofcom to ensure standards are met for both consumers and employees.
attributes.additional_details:
2.8 billion packages and parcels were delivered in 2016, a rise of 65% in four years, up from 1.7 billion in 2012. This represents a delivery market in the region of £10.1 billion in 2016. This is expected to grow in 2021 to around £13.2 billion.

Reading reviews of these delivery companies and the services they provide do not, however, make good reading. Deluges of parcels being lost or damaged, passing the buck back to sellers, excluding pretty much every item with a resale value from loss and poor delivery practices coming from pressures on delivery drivers and poor pay.

With even more retailers growing their online sales, this market is due to grow further with no signs of abating. The services being provided need to be properly regulated and companies held to account more easily.

attributes.action: The UK should agree to the UN's Global Compact for Migration
attributes.background: The Global Compact seeks to safeguard the rights of migrants and reduce the negative effects of sudden high levels of migration, partially by reducing the structural problems in countries that cause irregular migration.  The Compact is simply a framework for co operation and not legally binding.
attributes.additional_details:
Global Compact pdf - https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/sites/default/files/180713_agreed_outcome_global_compact_for_migration.pdf

UN brief description of Compact's aims: https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/migration-compact
